page.title: 12Older Housing. ELLESMERE
page.content: Most of Ellesmere's large beautiful past houses are falling to bits. Stanham is a Regency Gothic Villa of around 1820. The Hollies, still lived in by a crippled lady, is near the town centre, but a new road might destroy it. Tudor Cottage, in good condition, is probably the oldest house on the South West part of town and is one of the only brick and timber houses left in town. The cottages along Wharf Road have been changed dramatically, with new windows, square instead of a kind of pentagon. They were origonally for the Dairy workers (formely an iron foundary). Once they were small, now they are quite a good size. Railway Terrace was built for the raliway workers. The railway was behind them. The small cottages were extremely small, and conditions were bad.
